name: EndoscopicRadiofrequencyAblationRFA
title: Endoscopic Radiofrequency Ablation (RFA)
purpose:
(Clinical Focus: The purpose of this value set is to represent clinical concepts related to endoscopic radiofrequency ablation, a minimally invasive procedure that delivers radiofrequency energy via an endoscope to ablate abnormal tissue.),(Data Element Scope: This value set encompasses codes and descriptors for procedural techniques, clinical indications, and outcomes associated with endoscopic radiofrequency ablation, particularly in the management of gastrointestinal lesions such as Barrett's esophagus.),(Inclusion Criteria: Indications (must be pathologically confirmed):
(1) Flat esophageal precancerous lesions or esophageal squamous cell lesions with poor differentiation.
or (2) Barrett's esophagus combined with poorly differentiated lesions.
or (3) Barrett's esophagus greater than 3 cm in length and with intestinal metaplasia.),(Exclusion Criteria: No)
